Fun Fact for 3rd Graders: Has three buttons called valves.
Uses a long slide to change the sound.
The tubing is over 12 feet long if you uncurled it!
The biggest and lowest sounding brass instrument.
One of the only woodwinds you blow across instead of into.
Uses a single wooden reed to make its sound.
A shiny gold instrument used in jazz and rock music.
Uses a double reed and has a very clear piercing sound.
A very tall woodwind that plays very low notes.
The smallest string instrument held under the chin.
Played while sitting down with the instrument on the floor.
Has 47 strings and 7 pedals for the feet.
Has 6 strings and is very popular for campfire songs.
Has metal wires on the bottom that rattle.
The giant drum that provides the "boom" in a parade.
Has wooden bars that you hit with mallets.
Metal plates that make a loud "crash" when hit together.
A metal instrument in the shape of a triangle.
A ring with little metal jingles that you shake.
Shakers that usually come in a pair of two.
